ygData.subject: Re: Dark Elf SK
ygData.msgSnippet: I will give you that in time the DE could be more powerful faster (just because of the skill gain).  But give the Troll and Ogre some time (a lot of time) and
ygData.messageBody:
I will give you that in time the DE could be more powerful faster (just
because of the skill gain). But give the Troll and Ogre some time (a lot of
time) and they will most likely (other than mana) be just as strong in the
magic area too. But if I were to go back I would only put 1 to 3 points
into int, The rest into str, and some into sta. Plus I don't know if I even
will be able to wear plate at this point, just because of the weight limits,
unless I find light magic plate or something. I can only carry about 75
lbs. of equipment. And if all the equipment weight lets say 70 lbs.(? don't
know since I can't afford it) that gives me 5 lbs. of carrying capacity.
Hmmm... excuse me group I have to go to town to turn in this rusted mace
for cash because I can't carry anymore because I am encumbered by carrying
one mace, I am sure if I do this every time I loot I will be removed from
the group fairly fast. And since the system seems to be more item based
than cashed based, your income seems to me based basically on the amount of
items you can carry, and as I said in the last post cash is a big issue in
the game.

All I am saying is if you want to play a DE put the points into str (mainly)
and sta and very few into int, because you already have a large number
their. If not a DE and you go with an Ogre or Troll put the points mainly
into int.

And let me get back to spells for a second. At lvl 9 Disease Cloud does
5pts damage max (if not resisted) and stops the creature for standard
healing during battle which is nice. That is the only damaging spell you
have until lvl 15 then you get your first DOT (Damage over Time) spell. Sap
Strength works and doesn't ever seem to be resisted (imho) and some what
stops the creature from hitting you or hits you for less. Again you are
dealing with a lvl 14 player give me a better example why a DE is better
than a Troll or Ogre at say lvl 22 or 23 other than just a blanket statement
"they are better". Why are they better? more mana for the higher level
spells? memorize spells faster? less fizzle rate? the pet actually gets
better (instead of being a "milk bone" for bears and wolfs)? And what is a
DOT spell? does 5pts damage 1st round and 5pts the 2nd round? Remember I am
lvl 14 impress me, and impress the guy who started this question. By the way
what lvl are you? What spells do you like to use? What kind of advice can
you give us Dark Elf SK (DESK get it?). Should the person put in a lot of
points towards his/her int? or devote it to str?

Anyway, I am not trying to be belligerent, but give a reason for the pain
and tormenting we DE do at lower levels. Especially since we have to tank a
lot.

Tenin - Tarew Marr


----- Original Message -----
From: <AmataiCy@...>
To: <eq_shadowknights@onelist.com>
Sent: Monday, June 14, 1999 11:56 AM
Subject: Re: [eq_shadowknights] Dark Elf SK


From: AmataiCy@...

You guys are crazy. Dark elfs are probably the best SK. For over all reasons
too. There stats are more balanced, they're int is higher, and eventually
they'll pass up the ogre and troll in higher levels because of more powerful
spells

Amatai
